intro: Rhynchospora leucostachys, commonly known as white-stemmed spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy environments in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant has slender, cylindrical stems that are often tinged with white or pale green, and its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small, white to pale brown flowers. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, and its rhizomes help it spread vegetatively. Rhynchospora leucostachys plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
